definition: to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me

sentences.english: He was still frightened of the veterinary surgeons.
sentences.chinese: 他对外科兽医一直心有余悸。
每次余震都让李女士心有余悸。

sentences.english: Plot of the film makes people shudder at.
sentences.chinese: 影片情节让人心有余悸。

sentences.english: Even after many years, in retrospect, still have a lingering fear.
sentences.chinese: 即使事隔多年，回想起来，仍是心有余悸。

sentences.english: The first two or three days I was alone there still scare me.
sentences.chinese: 对刚开始孤独一人的两三天我至今仍心有余悸。

sentences.english: Those who had survived were still shocked by the quake that destroyed their world.
sentences.chinese: 这场毁了他们家园的地震仍然使那些幸存者心有余悸。

sentences.english: Long after the panic and the pain had passed, she was haunted by the experience.
sentences.chinese: 惊慌与痛苦早已过去，她仍心有余悸。

definition: lingering fear/fear after the event/post-traumatic stress
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
lit. heart alarmed, body leaping (idiom); fear and trepidation in the face of disaster
to have just recovered from a shock
to have a close call/to have a narrow escape
mortal danger, escape alive (idiom); a narrow escape/to survive by the skin of one's teeth
safe and sound (idiom)/to come out unscathed (e.g. from an accident or illness)
